item.description:
William Lee developed the first rudimentary knitting machine in 1600. The legend says he was jealous of the attention his girlfriend paid to her knitting, so he invented a machine to gain back her affections. Today the knitting machine exists in much the same form as it did in the 17th century, using a fixed bed of hooked needles with each needle holding a stitch.

This fiber fact and many more to come.

Also we have a knit night coming up.
item.name: Do That Yarn Thing -Wednesday April 15th
